Title: St. Catherine's Monastery, Sinai Arabic 553.
Associated name: Macarius, the Egyptian, Saint, active 4th century|~|John Chrysostom, Saint, -407|~|Ephraem, Syrus, Saint, 303-373
Contents note: Twenty-four tracts and treatises of miscellaneous nature, divisible into the following categories: 1 - Theological debate, the Orthodox Creed, list of the great Prophets, philosophers’ prophecies, the Passion of Our Lord, and a selection of testimonies derived from the Old and New Testaments. 2 - Story of a monk from China and some jurists. 3 - Stories from the Lives of Saints and Church Fathers, some anonymous, others mentioned by name, as SS. Verosius, Philip the Apostle, Mark of Scetis, and the Seven Youths of Ephesus. 4 - Apophthegmata and Mimars by SS. Macarius, John Chrysostom and Ephraem the Syrian. 5 - An Encomium to Our Lady

Associated name: Basil, Saint, Bishop of Caesarea, approximately 329-379|~|Ephraem, Syrus, Saint, 303-373|~|John Chrysostom, Saint, -407
Contents note: Preceded by the following miscellaneous treatises: 1 - Book of Problems and Responses between Abbot Antiochus and St. Athanasius I Patriarch of Alexandria (53 Problems and Responses). 2 - Three Lives of Saints and Miracles of SS. John of the Golden Gospel, Theodore and Basil Bishop of Caesarea. 3 - Story of the Incarnate Icon of Our Lady in the Monastery of Saidanaya. 4 - Mystical table with aphorisms. 5 - Three tracts derived from the writings of SS. John Chrysostom, Basil the Great and Ephraem the Syrian on miscellaneous topics. 6 - Poem in praise of the Holy Land by Abd al-Masifi. 7 - History of Lent and Easter
